## How to add your own project

1. Copy this file (or any project in `projects/`) and rename it (e.g. `my-analysis.qmd`).
2. Edit the YAML: `title`, `description`, `date`, `author`, and optional `image`, `categories`.
3. Write your narrative and add code chunks, figures, or links below.

## Example: simple R code chunk

You can embed executable R (or Python) code. Readers see the code and output.

```{r}
#| label: fig-simple-plot
#| fig-cap: "Example plot â€” replace with your own data and visualization."
#| echo: true

x <- seq(0, 2 * pi, length.out = 50)
y <- sin(x)
plot(x, y, type = "l", col = "#2c5282", lwd = 2,
     xlab = "x", ylab = "sin(x)", main = "Simple sine wave")
```

## Embedding static or interactive visuals

- **Static:** Use `knitr`/Jupyter to generate plots; they appear in the page.
- **Interactive:** Save HTML from Plotly, Leaflet, etc., and embed with an iframe or link.
- **GitHub / Observable:** Link to notebooks or dashboards and add a short summary here.

## Optional: freeze heavy computations

If rendering is slow or environment-specific, add to `projects/_metadata.yml`:

```yaml
freeze: true
```

Then re-render individual posts when you change them; the rest of the site will reuse frozen output.
